intro: Xanthophyllum sumatranum, commonly known as the Sumatran goldenleaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring. Xanthophyllum sumatranum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
